intro: Colea barbatula, commonly known as the hairy coleus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Colea barbatula is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant foliage and floral display.
